intro: Actinolepis tenella, commonly known as the small-leafed rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, alternate leaves that are typically rounded or ovate. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the mustard family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions. Actinolepis tenella is an herbaceous perennial that is adapted to cold climates and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
